{{use dmy dates|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox royalty | name = Abdullah bin Faisal | title = | image = | caption = | spouse = | issue = | full name = Abdullah bin Faisal bin Turki bin Abdullah Al Saud | styles = | succession = Governor of [[Saudi Arabian General Investment Authority|Saudi Arabian General Investment Authority (SAGIA)]] | reign = 2000–2004 | reign-type = In office |reg-type = Monarch |regent = [[Fahd of Saudi Arabia|King Fahd]] | predecessor= ''Office established'' | successor = [[Amr Dabbagh]] | succession1 = Saudi Ambassador to the United States | reign1 = October 2015 – 23 April 2017 | reign-type1 = In office |predecessor1= [[Adel al-Jubeir]] |reg-type1 = Monarch |regent1 = [[King Salman]] | successor1 = [[Khalid bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud|Khalid bin Salman Al Saud]] | father = Faisal bin Turki bin Abdullah bin Saud Al Saud | mother = [[Luluwah bint Abdulaziz Al Saud]] | birth_date ={{birth year and age|1951}} | birth_place = [[Taif]], [[Saudi Arabia]] | house = [[House of Saud]] | almamater = | religion = [[Wahhabi]] [[Hanbali]] [[Sunni Islam]] }} '''Abdullah bin Faisal Al Saud''' ([[Arabic]]:'''عبد الله بن فيصل بن تركي بن عبد الله بن سعود آل سعود''') (born 1951) is a member of [[House of Saud]]. Between October 2015 and April 2017 he was Saudi Arabia's ambassador to the [[United States]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Prince Abdullah bin Faisal bin Turki Al Saud Named New Ambassador to the United States|url=http://sustg.com/prince-abdullah-bin-faisal-bin-turki-al-saud-sworn-in-as-new-ambassador-to-the-united-states/|work=SUSTG|accessdate=23 November 2015}}</ref>
==Early life and education== Abdullah bin Faisal was born in [[Taif]] in 1951.<ref name=eui>{{cite web|title=HRH Prince Abdullah bin Faisal bin Turki al Saud |url=http://www.eui.eu/RSCAS/Research/Mediterranean-Archive/mspr2003/Abdu.shtml |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130213080940/http://www.eui.eu/RSCAS/Research/Mediterranean-Archive/mspr2003/Abdu.shtml |dead-url=yes |archive-date=13 February 2013 |work=European University Institute |accessdate=7 June 2012 |date=3 April 2003 }}</ref><ref name=wasrepme>{{cite web|author=Richard H. Curtiss|title=Prince Abdullah bin Faisal bin Turki Al Saud|url=http://wrmea.org/component/content/article/135-wrmea-archives/washington-report-archives-1988-1993/november-1991/5466-personality-prince-abdullah-bin-faisal-bin-turki-al-saud.html|work=Washington Report on Middle East Affairs|accessdate=7 June 2012|date=November 2001}}</ref> His mother, [[Luluwah bint Abdulaziz Al Saud|Luluwah bint Abdulaziz]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Family Tree of Luluwah bint Abdulaziz bin Abdul Rahman Al Saud|url=http://www.datarabia.com/royals/famtree.do?id=176924|work=Datarabia|accessdate=12 August 2012}}</ref> is the full sister of [[Sudairi Seven]].<ref name=wasrepme/><ref name=usatoday/><ref name=pbsblfam>{{cite news|title=About the Bin Laden family|url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/shows/binladen/who/family.html|accessdate=26 February 2013|work=PBS}}</ref> He has six siblings and is the oldest of them.<ref name=alg>{{cite news|title=Saudi Arabia’s Ambassador to the United States: Who Is Abdullah bin Faisal bin Turki Al Saud?|url=http://www.allgov.com/news/appointments-and-resignations/saudi-arabias-ambassador-to-the-united-states-who-is-abdullah-bin-faisal-bin-turki-al-saud-160321?news=858508|accessdate=18 November 2016|work=AllGov|date=21 March 2016}}</ref> His brother, Sultan bin Faisal bin Turki, was killed in a car crash at age 41 on 23 July 2002 while coming from [[Jeddah]] to Riyadh to participate in funeral prayers for [[Ahmed bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud|Prince Ahmed]], son of [[Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud|Prince Salman]],<ref name=usatoday>{{cite news|author=John R. Bradley|title=Prince Ahmed's cousin killed on way to funeral|url=https://www.usatoday.com/sports/horses/stories/2002-07-23-salman-funeral_x.htm|accessdate=9 August 2012|work=USA Today|date=23 July 2002|agency=AP}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Prince dies in car crash on way to Ahmad’s funeral|url=http://www.arabnews.com/node/222783|accessdate=14 August 2012|newspaper=Arab News|date=24 July 2002}}</ref> who has been the King of Saudi Arabia since 2015.
Prince Abdullah's family on the father's side is directly descended from [[Saud bin Faisal bin Turki|Saud bin Faisal]].<ref name=wasrepme/> Saud's rule as well as that of his brother Abdullah marked the end of [[Second Saudi State|the second Saudi state]] after an invasion of [[Ottomans]] early in the 19th century.<ref name=wasrepme/>
Prince Abdullah received elementary and secondary education in Saudi Arabia.<ref name=sauam/> He then went to the United Kingdom for higher education<ref name=wasrepme/> where he studied engineering.<ref name=eui/>
==Career and activities== Prince Abdullah's early career as an engineer involved both technical and management positions. He assumed the responsibility of the coordination of various studies for the two industrial cities, and later for the industrial security and safety sector.<ref name=eui/>
Abdullah bin Faisal began his career at the Royal Commission for Jubail and Yanbu immediately after its establishment in 1975.<ref name=eui/> He served as the acting secretary general of the Royal Commission from 1985 to 1987. Then, he was appointed secretary general of the royal commission in 1987.<ref name=sj>{{cite news|title=Saudis confident US presence will prevent Iraq attack|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=3TkpAAAAIBAJ&sjid=NmUFAAAAIBAJ&pg=1484,3825855&dq=abdullah+bin+faisal+bin+turki&hl=en|accessdate=10 December 2012|newspaper=Sun Journal|date=21 August 1990}}</ref> Next, he was appointed chairman of the body in 1991 and he served as chief executive officer of the commission and chairman of its board of directors.<ref name=eui/><ref>{{cite web|title=Royal decrees on ministerial and top-level appointments|url=http://www.saudiembassy.net/archive/1997/news/page137.aspx|work=Saudi Embassy|accessdate=23 June 2012|date=6 July 1997}}</ref>
In April 2000, [[Saudi Arabian General Investment Authority|Saudi Arabian General Investment Authority (SAGIA)]] was created, responsible for promotions of the foreign and domestic investments in Saudi Arabia.<ref>{{cite web|title=About SAGIA |url=http://www.gcf.org.sa/en/About-GCF/About-SAGIA/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091019191332/http://gcf.org.sa/en/About-GCF/About-SAGIA/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=19 October 2009 |work=Global Competitiveness Forum |accessdate=7 June 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Simon Henderson| url=http://www.washingtoninstitute.org/uploads/Documents/pubs/PolicyFocus96.pdf|title=After King Abdullah|work=Washington Institute|accessdate=28 July 2012|format=Policy Paper|date=August 2009}}</ref> Prince Abdullah was appointed governor of SAGIA with the rank of minister in 2000.<ref name=eui/><ref name=ameinfo03>{{cite news|title=Prince Abdullah bin Faisal bin Turki Al Saud |url=http://www.ameinfo.com/23570.html |accessdate=7 June 2012 |work=AMEinfo |date=6 May 2003 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100529034728/http://www.ameinfo.com/23570.html |archivedate=29 May 2010 }}</ref> His tenure lasted until 2004 when he resigned from this post.<ref name=pbs>{{cite web|title=Wide Angle|url=https://www.pbs.org/wnet/wideangle/episodes/the-saudi-question/whos-who-the-house-of-saud/prince-abdullah-bin-faisal-bin-turki-al-saud/2885/|work=PBS|accessdate=7 June 2012}}</ref> It was speculated that since he was frustrated with the government’s bureaucratic approach and the slow pace of the reforms in the country, he left SAGIA.<ref name=pbs/>
Prince Abdullah was the chairman of Saudi Italian Development Company (SIDCO), charged with the task of revitalizing Saudi Arabia's economy. Since he had knowledge of the Italian economy, he was regarded as the most appropriate figure to support the commercial relations between [[Saudi Arabia]] and [[Italy]].<ref name=sidco>{{cite web|title=Board of Directors|url=http://www.sa-sidco.com/English/Mgt.html|work=Saudi Italian Development Company Limited (SIDCO)|accessdate=7 June 2012|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130202194446/http://www.sa-sidco.com/English/Mgt.html|archive-date=2 February 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In October 2015 Prince Abdullah became the Saudi ambassador to the USA.<ref name=sauam>{{cite news|author=Dina al-Shibeeb|title=Abdullah bin Faisal named new Saudi ambassador to Washington|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2015/10/21/Abdullah-bin-Faisal-named-new-Saudi-ambassador-to-Washington-.html|accessdate=27 October 2015|work=Al Arabiya|date=21 October 2015}}</ref> He succeeded [[Adel al-Jubeir]] in the post.<ref name=sauam/> On 23 April 2017 Prince Khalid bin Salman Al Saud replaced Prince Abdullah as ambassador to the USA.<ref>{{cite news|title=Saudi Royal decree announces new appointments, restores benefits to government employees|url=http://www.arabnews.com/node/1088886/saudi-arabia|accessdate=23 April 2017|work=Arab News|date=23 April 2017}}</ref>
===SAGIA governorship=== When Prince Abdullah was the governor of SAGIA, he strongly supported both liberal policies and privatization in the Saudi Arabia’s economy.<ref>{{cite web|title=Saudi Arabia's New Private Sector Investment Strategies|url=http://www.idcworld.com/saudiprivate.htm|work=International Development Consultants, LLC|accessdate=7 June 2012}}</ref> Nearly 2,000 foreign business licenses were issued during his tenure. The worth of these licenses were estimated to be 15 billion U.S. dollars.<ref name=ameinfo03/><ref name=pbs/> Prince Abdullah further encouraged the membership of Saudi Arabia to [[the World Trade Organization]].<ref name=pbs/> However, this goal was not achieved at that time because of Saudi Arabia’s protectionist policies towards the industries of oil production and telecommunications, and its inability to produce a formal trade agreement with the United States.<ref name=pbs/>
==Personal life== Abdullah bin Faisal is married and has four children:<ref name=wasrepme/> Turki, Salman, Elanoude and Sarah.<ref name="alg"/> He is keenly interested in environmental issues and in international relations as well as in the arts.<ref name=eui/>
==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=33em}}

{{Infobox person | name = Albert Thys | image = Albert Thys (1849-1915), view 2, sculptor unknown - Royal Museum for Central Africa - DSC06710.JPG | image_size = 200px | alt = Sculpture of a young man wearing a military uniform with a prominent moustache | caption = Sculpture bust of Thys at the [[Royal Museum for Central Africa]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date|1849|11|28}} | birth_place = [[Dalhem]], [[Belgium]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1915|02|10|1849|11|28}} | death_place = [[Brussels]], [[Belgium]] | nationality = Belgian | other_names = | occupation = Businessman | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = }}
'''Albert Thys''' (28 November 1849 – 10 February 1915) was a Belgian businessman who was active in the [[Congo Free State]]. He gave his name of Thysville to the station of Sona Qongo, currently [[Mbanza-Ngungu]] in [[Bas-Congo]].
Born in [[Dalhem]], Thys graduated at the École de guerre, before entering into the service of king [[Leopold II of Belgium]] in 1876, as secretary of the colonial businesses. After the return of [[Henry Morton Stanley]], the king sent Thys to [[England]] to propose a new expedition to Central Africa on behalf of the [[Association Internationale Africaine]]. Thys was actively involved in the organisation of the first expeditions which would lead to the constitution of the Congo Free State.
After arriving in Congo in 1887 he promoted the [[Matadi-Kinshasa Railway|Matadi-Léopoldville Railway]], which was built from 1890 to 1898. He imposed a route by the south, deviating from the [[Congo river]]. He was one of the principal craftsmen of the development and the economic development of the Congo Free State and [[Belgian Congo]]. Notably he created the {{illm|Compagnie du Congo pour le Commerce et l'Industrie|nl}} (27 December 1886) and many of its subsidiary companies: the [[Compagnie du Chemin de Fer du Congo]] (CCFC), the ''Compagnie des Magasins généraux'', the ''Société anonyme Belge pour le Commerce du Haut-Congo'', the ''Compagnie des¨Produits'', the ''[[Compagnie du Katanga]]''.
He died in [[Brussels]], aged 66, in 1915.
== Literature== {{commonscat|Albert Thys}} * {{fr icon}} Georges Defauwes, Albert Thys, de Dalhem au Congo, Collection Comté de Dalhem [http://www.dalhem.be/WEBSITE/_Download/PDFDivers/AlbertThys_Defauwes.pdf online]

{{About|the parent and film company|the film production subsidiary|Amblin Entertainment|the television production subsidiary|Amblin Television}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:Amblin Partners}} {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox company | name = Storyteller Holding Co., LLC{{Cite web|url=https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1297401/000119312516450671/d277745dex991.htm|title=EX-99.1|website=www.sec.gov|access-date=2016-11-27}}
Storyteller Distribution Co., LLC | logo = Amblin Partners logo.svg | trading_name = Amblin Partners | type = [[Joint venture]] | foundation = {{start date and years ago|2015|12|16|mf=yes}} | founders = {{ubl|[[Steven Spielberg]]|[[Jeffrey Skoll|Jeff Skoll]]|[[Darren Throop]]|[[Anil Ambani]]}} | location_city = [[Universal City, California|Universal City]], California | location_country = United States | area_served = Worldwide | key_people = {{ubl|Steven Spielberg|{{small|(Chairman and CEO)}}|[[Jeff Small]]|{{small|(President and Co-CEO)}}|Holly Bario|{{small|(President of Production)}}}} | industry = Entertainment | products = [[Film|Motion pictures]]
Television | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | num_employees = | owners = {{ubl|The Amblin Group|[[Participant Media]]|[[Reliance Entertainment]]|{{small|([[Reliance Group|Reliance ADA Group]])}}|[[Entertainment One]]|[[Alibaba Pictures]]|{{small|([[Alibaba Group]])}}|[[Universal Pictures|Universal Studios]]|{{small|([[NBCUniversal]])}}}} | divisions = {{ubl|[[Amblin Entertainment]]|[[Amblin Television]]|[[DreamWorks|DreamWorks Pictures]]}} | subsid = | homepage = {{URL|www.amblinpartners.com}} | footnotes = | intl = }} '''Amblin Partners''' (legally known as '''Storyteller Holding Co., LLC''' and '''Storyteller Distribution Co., LLC''') is an American content creation and entertainment company which produces and develops films and television programming. Amblin is a restructured [[DreamWorks|DreamWorks Studios]]. ==History== Amblin Partners was founded by [[Steven Spielberg]], [[Jeffrey Skoll|Jeff Skoll]] of [[Participant Media]], [[Anil Ambani]] of [[Reliance Group|Reliance Anil Dhirubhai Ambani Group]] and [[Darren Throop]] of [[Entertainment One]] on December 16, 2015. The company will primarily focus on producing and distributing films and television using the [[DreamWorks|DreamWorks Pictures]], [[Amblin Entertainment]] and [[Participant Media]] brands.{{cite news|last1=Cieply|first1=Michael|title=Steven Spielberg and DreamWorks Studios in Deal to Form New Company|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/17/business/media/steven-spielberg-and-dreamworks-studios-in-deal-to-form-new-company.html?_r=0|accessdate=December 23, 2015|work=The New York Times|date=December 16, 2015}} For films, it will use the DreamWorks label for mature content, Amblin label for family-friendly content, and Participant label for [[social justice]] content, although the latter will remain a separate company.{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/steven-spielbergs-dreamworks-relaunches-as-amblin-partners-1450301848|title=Steven Spielberg's DreamWorks Relaunches as Amblin Partners|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|date=December 16, 2015|accessdate=December 16, 2015}} On the same day as the company's formation, Amblin Partners announced that it entered into a five-year distribution deal with [[Universal Pictures]] by which the films will be distributed and marketed by either the main Universal label or its specialty label, [[Focus Features]].{{cite news|last1 = Lang|first1 = Brent|title = Steven Spielberg, Jeff Skoll Bring Amblin Partners to Universal|url = https://variety.com/2015/film/news/steven-spiellberg-universal-1201662956/|accessdate = December 23, 2015|work = Variety|date = December 16, 2015}}{{cite news|last1 = Busch|first1 = Anita|title = It's Official: Spielberg, DreamWorks, Participant, eOne, Others Pact For Amblin Partners|url = http://deadline.com/2015/12/spielberg-dreamworks-participant-eone-others-pact-for-amblin-partners-1201668244/|accessdate = December 23, 2015|work = Deadline.com|date = December 16, 2015}} ''[[The Girl on the Train (2016 film)|The Girl on the Train]]'' was the first film released under the new agreement.{{cite news|author1 = Pamela McClintock|author2 = Gregg Kilday|title = Steven Spielberg, Jeff Skoll Team to Form Amblin Partners, Strike Distribution Deal With Universal|url = http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/steven-spielberg-jeff-skoll-team-849249|accessdate = December 22, 2015|work = The Hollywood Reporter|date = December 16, 2015}} On October 9, 2016, Amblin Partners struck a deal with China's [[Alibaba Pictures]], in which Alibaba acquired a minority equity stake in the company and will handle marketing, distribution support and merchandising of Amblin Partners films in China in addition to co-financing Amblin and DreamWorks films worldwide.{{cite news|last1=Frater|first1=Patrick|title=Steven Spielberg's Amblin Partners Inks Strategic Pact With Alibaba Pictures|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/asia/steven-spielberg-strategic-pact-with-alibaba-pictures-1201883159/|accessdate=February 24, 2017|work=Variety|date=October 9, 2016}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/la-fi-ct-universal-amblin-20170215-story.html|title=Universal buys minority stake in Steven Spielberg's Amblin Partners|last=Faughnder|first=Ryan|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-02-27}} On February 15, 2017, Universal acquired a minority stake in Amblin Partners,{{Cite news|url=http://deadline.com/2017/02/universal-buys-minority-stake-amblin-partners-1201912406/|title=Universal Buys Minority Stake In Amblin Partners|last=Lieberman|first=David|date=2017-02-15|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-02-27|language=en-US}} strengthening the relationship between Universal and Amblin,{{cite news|last1 = Perry|first1 = Spencer|title = Universal Studios Buys a Minority Stake in Amblin Partners|url = http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/814659-universal-studios-buys-a-minority-stake-in-amblin-partners|accessdate = February 20, 2017|work = Comingsoon.net|date = February 15, 2017}} and reuniting a minority percentage of the DreamWorks Pictures label with its former animation division [[DreamWorks Animation]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.thewrap.com/universal-acquires-minority-stake-steven-spielberg-amblin-partners/|title=Universal Acquires Minority Stake in Steven Spielberg's Amblin Partners|date=2017-02-15|work=TheWrap|access-date=2018-02-27|language=en-US}} In December 2017, Amblin Partners signed a music publishing deal with [[BMG Rights Management]], covering music from its films and TV series.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2017/biz/news/amblin-partners-inks-exclusive-music-publishing-deal-with-bmg-1202643535|title=Amblin Partners Inks Exclusive Music-Publishing Deal With BMG|first=Variety|last=Staff|date=December 18, 2017|publisher=}} ==Films== ===Released=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Title ! Release date ! Co-production ! {{Infobox person | name = A. Ari Aramesh (Arash Ari Aramesh) | image =http://www.foxnews.com/on-air/hannity/sites/foxnews.com.on-air.hannity/files/aresh%20aramesh.jpg | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Arash Ari Aramesh | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1984|4|19}} | birth_place = | residence = [[New York City|New York]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S. | nationality = American | education = Juris Doctor, Doctorate of Law, Master and Bachelor in Political Science | alma_mater = {{ubl|[[University of California, Berkeley]] ([[B.A.]]) | [[London School of Economics and Political Science]] ([[M.Sc.]]) [[Stanford Law School]] ([[Juris Doctor|J.D.]])}} | occupation = Lawyer, political and national security commentator | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = | home_town = [[Thousand Oaks]], California }}
'''Ari Aramesh''' (born April 19, 1984) is an American lawyer, entrepreneur, political commentator, and national security and foreign policy analyst. Aramesh is known for his appearances on CNN, [[Fox News]], [[BBC News]], [[MSNBC]], and [[Sky News]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/transcript/2016/12/28/israeli-ambassador-fires-back-at-kerry-muslim-woman-says-is-being-harassed-for/|title=Israeli ambassador fires back at Kerry; Muslim woman says she is being harassed for supporting Trump|date=2016-12-28|newspaper=Fox News|access-date=2017-02-17|language=en-US}}</ref> A California native, Aramesh resides in [[New York City|New York]], NY where he practices law.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://www.yettercoleman.com/profiles/aramesh-a-ari/|title=Aramesh, A. Ari - Yetter Coleman LLP|newspaper=Yetter Coleman LLP|access-date=2017-02-17|language=en-US}}</ref>
== Education == Aramesh attended the [[University of California, Berkeley]]. At Berkeley, Aramesh earned two bachelor degrees, one in Political Science and another in Middle Eastern Studies. Aramesh undertook studying Arabic literature while mastering the Persian language in an effort to become fluent in critical languages of the Middle East.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/BAY-AREA-Iranian-Americans-are-finding-their-2535314.php|title=BAY AREA / Iranian Americans are finding their voice / Tense U.S.-Iran relations motivate many|newspaper=SFGate|access-date=2017-02-17}}</ref>
After graduating from UC Berkeley, Aramesh attended the [[London School of Economics and Political Science]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/author/arash-aramesh|title=Arash Aramesh {{!}} The Huffington Post|website=www.huffingtonpost.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-02-17}}</ref> Aramesh graduated from LSE with a master of science degree ''with merit'' in Comparative Politics and Conflict Studies. Following graduation, he moved to Washington, D.C., to work at The Century Foundation as an Associate of the Iran Program.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/08/05/opinion/05iht-edabdo.html|title=The Widening Rift Among Iran's Clerics|last=Abdo|first=Geneive|date=2010-08-04|newspaper=The New York Times|access-date=2017-02-17|last2=Aramesh|first2=Arash|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/geneive-abdo/clash-over-mashaei-reveal_b_853329.html|title=Clash Over Mashaei Reveals Fissures Within the Iranian Regime|last=Abdo|first=Geneive|date=2011-04-26|website=The Huffington Post|access-date=2017-02-17}}</ref>
Next, he attended Stanford Law School, where he served as Member Editor and Article Selection Committee Member of the ''Stanford Journal of International Law''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://english.aawsat.com/author/arash-aramesh|title=Arash Aramesh, Author at ASHARQ AL-AWSAT English|last=Al-awsat|first=Asharq|website=ASHARQ AL-AWSAT English|language=en-US|access-date=2017-02-17}}</ref> While at Stanford, he worked as a teaching assistant to former Secretary of Defense, William Perry, and former Director of Los Alamos National Laboratory, Sig Hecker. He also was a director of Stanford Law School's Afghanistan Legal Education Project.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.stanforddaily.com/2013/02/11/students-debate-irans-nuclear-program-in-united-nations-simulation/|title=Students debate Iran’s nuclear program in United Nations simulation|last=Obeegadoo|first=Nikhita|website=Stanford Daily|access-date=2017-02-17}}</ref> He has published in The New York Times (International Herald Tribune), the Huffington Post, the Majalla, G20 Seoul Summit Publication, and the Diplomatic Courier, among others.<ref>https://law.stanford.edu/stanford-lawyer/articles/weighing-in-the-muslim-brotherhood-and-the-egyptian-militarys-ouster-of-mohammad-morsi/</ref>
== Career == Prior to practicing law, Aramesh co-founded a physician placement company.<ref name=":0" /> He practiced at the litigation firm Yetter Coleman in Texas and, after two years, returned to California and joined [[Quinn Emanuel Urquhart & Sullivan]]. Aramesh is a white collar and complex commercial litigation attorney at the New York City office of [http://www.zuberlaw.com/lawfirm/attorney_biographies/a_ari_aramesh/2/ Zuber Lawler & Del Duca LLP].
== References == <references />__FORCETOC__
== External links == * [https://twitter.com/ArameshArash Arash Aramesh] on [[Twitter]] * [https://www.youtube.com/user/aneeneh/videos Arash Aramesh] on [[YouTube|Youtube]] __INDEX__

revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Arthur K. Bell <!-- include middle initial, if not specified in birth_name --> | image = <!-- just the filename, without the File: or Image: prefix or enclosing [[brackets]] --> | alt = | caption = | birth_name = <!-- only use if different from name --> | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1868|10|04}} | birth_place = Craigie, Perth | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1942|04|26|1868|10|04}} | death_place = Campsie Hill, Perth | residence = Kincarrathie House, Perth | nationality = [[United Kingdom|Scottish]] | other_names = AK Bell | parents = Arthur Bell | occupation = [[distillation|distiller]] | years_active = 1895–1942 | spouse = Cammilla Bruce (married 1899–1942) | known_for = Former owner of Arthur Bell & Sons Ltd, and founder of the Gannochy Trust. }}
'''Arthur Kinmond Bell''', also known as '''AK Bell''', (4 October 1868–16 April 1942) was a Scottish distiller, working as a partner of [[Arthur Bell & Sons Ltd]], and as a philanthropist, founding the [[Gannochy Trust]] to help support the people of his home city of [[Perth, Scotland|Perth]].
==Birth and family life== Throughout much of his life Bell resided in [[Perth, Scotland|Perth]], born on 4 October 1868 at Moncreife Terrace, Craigie, Perth. Educated first at [[Perth Academy]] he later moved to [[Edinburgh]] continuing his studies at [[Craigmount School]].<ref name=Oxford_DNB>{{cite web|last1=Weir|first1=Ronald B.|title=Bell, Arthur|url=http://www.oxforddnb.com/templates/article.jsp?articleid=50406&back=|website=Oxford DNB|publisher=Oxford University Press|accessdate=13 July 2014}}</ref>
In 1899 Bell married Miss Cammilla Bruce.<ref name=Chronology>{{cite web|title=Arthur Kinmond Bell – Chronology|url=http://www.gannochytrust.org.uk/community/arthur-kinmond-bell-chronology|website=Gannochy Trust|accessdate=12 July 2014}}</ref> The ceremony was conducted in her native city of Edinburgh, but with both in their late 30s at the time of the marriage, a life without children seemed probable. It has been speculated that this contributed to his desire to make a lasting mark, leading to his [[philanthropy]].<ref name=Duncan_2012>{{cite book|last1=Duncan|first1=Jeremy|title=A Roof Over One's Head|date=2012|publisher=Farquhar and Son Ltd|location=Perth|isbn=978-0-9560620-7-9|pages=16–33}}</ref>
==Career== Bell joined the family business as a partner in 1895, following in the path of his father and grandfather.<ref name=Bells_History>{{cite web|last1=Nielson|first1=AC|title=Our History|url=http://www.bells.co.uk/?History|website=Bell's|publisher=Bell's|accessdate=10 July 2014}}</ref> He quickly made his mark, and along with his brother, Robert, succeeded in doubling the company's profits before his father's death in 1900.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Duncan|first1=Jeremy|title=A Roof Over One's Head|date=2012|publisher=Farquhar and Son Ltd|location=Perth|isbn=978-0-9560620-7-9|page=14}}</ref> At this time Bell, as the eldest son, became managing director, and continued to expand the business despite the setbacks of the [[Great Depression]] and [[Prohibition in the United States]], becoming governor director in 1921 when the company became a limited company.<ref name="Courier at RootWeb">{{cite news|title=Perth's Tribute to A. K. Bell extract available at RootsWeb|url=http://archiver.rootsweb.ancestry.com/th/read/SANDEMAN/2004-10/1097742672|accessdate=13 July 2014|work=The Courier and Advertiser|date=4 July 1994|ref=The Courier and Advertiser}}</ref> This expansion was achieved in large part through the use of advertising and agents, many of whom were members of his extended family living throughout the empire, and included the friendly takeover of three distilleries between 1933–1936. By the time of Bell's death in 1942, the company's profits were in excess of £100,000 per annum.<ref>{{cite book|title=Chambers Scottish Biographical Dictionary|date=1992|publisher=Chambers Ltd|location=Edinburgh and New York|isbn=0-550-16043-4}}</ref>
Later in his life, Bell saved the Perth linen industry by financially backing the one remaining company, John Shields and Co. intervening at the request of the [[Lord Provost]] Robert Nimmo.<ref>{{cite news|title=A Perth Authority on Linen Manufacture|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2507&dat=19390626&id=y0VAAAAAIBAJ&sjid=kYUMAAAAIBAJ&pg=3825,4070184|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=Glasgow Herald|publisher=Herald and Times Group|date=26 June 1939}}</ref> The apparent and imminent closure of this company came as a shock to the [[Perth and Kinross Council|local council]], and the loss of 300 jobs would have been a blow to the city,. For his contribution Bell receiving the Freedom of Perth, and the workers of the company presented him with a parchment tribute as a thanks for his part in turning the company into a successful and growing enterprise.<ref name=Duncan_2012 /> Following his purchase of the company, Bell reconstructed the firm and re-equipped it for artificial fibre production, helping to secure the business into the future.<ref name=Oxford_DNB />
==Philanthropic activities== :"After a man has a roof over his head and his bread and butter is fairly well assured and has a surplus, I think you will agree with me that it is only common sense that he should spend part of that surplus for the benefit of his native city."<ref name=75_Celebration>{{cite news|title=Perth-born distiller Arthur Kinmond remembered|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/local-news/perth-born-distiller-arthur-kinmond-remembered-2731937|accessdate=10 July 2014|work=Daily Record|date=14 February 2012}}</ref>
This quotation from Bell's acceptance of the Freedom of Perth sums up his approach to philanthropy, and how as a beneficiary of the then booming [[Scotch whisky]] trade, Bell prospered and was able to look to benefit his home city. His first major project in this direction was the building of the Gannochy Housing Estate between 1924 and 1932.<ref name="Bell and Trust">{{cite web|title=A K Bell and the Gannochy Trust|url=http://www.gannochytrust.org.uk/index.php?page=a-k-bell|website=Gannochy Trust|accessdate=10 July 2014}}</ref> This model housing scheme was intended to benefit the hardworking of a younger generation, who had survived the harshness of war and were now looking to better themselves, with many of the original tenancies being granted to workers of Bell & Sons.<ref name=Duncan_2012 />
His next major project was the establishment of the [[Gannochy Trust]] in 1937,<ref name=Chronology /> founded partly to maintain the Gannochy estate and partly to ensure the continuing improvement of his native city into the future, even after his death.<ref name="Bell and Trust" />
After housing, the other major concern for post-war Perth was the supply of clean water, with the [[River Tay]] becoming increasingly polluted. In answer to this problem Bell provided shares in Bell's Whisky to the Gannochy Trust for the purpose of establishing Sewage treatment works for Perth and the surrounding villages, having previously commissioned a survey of what needed to be done to improve the situation in 1925. In total the trust was able to provide £640,000 towards the projects, with the one in Perth being completed in 1971.<ref name="Bell and Trust" />
==Recognition== In contrast to many of his local contemporaries, such as [[John Dewar, 1st Baron Forteviot]] and [[Robert Pullar]], Bell received comparatively few public honours for his philanthropic activities during his life.<ref name=Duncan_2012 /> One distinction he did receive, on 18 March 1938, was the Freedom of Perth,<ref name=Chronology /> which he described as his greatest honour. This honour was granted primarily for his role in saving John Shields and Co. rather than for any of his philanthropic activities, which appear to have been done quietly and gone without any major public awareness during his life, a fact he would likely have been grateful for.<ref name=Duncan_2012 />
In 1994, the decision was taken to name Perth's new multi-million-pound library the A. K. Bell library in honour of the man who had played such a large part in the city's history and whose legacy has had such a large impact on the city.<ref name="Courier at RootWeb" /> The library officially opened in 1995.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Lambert|first1=Tim|title=A Brief History of Perth|url=http://www.localhistories.org/perth.html|website=localhistories.org|accessdate=31 July 2014}}</ref>
==Death== Arthur Kinmond Bell died unexpectedly of illness on 26 April 1942.<ref name=Duncan_2012 /> His will, though, proved him to be as generous in death as he was in life, gifting to 3 senior employees of Arthur Bell and Sons the sum of £5000, to all staff with 10 years experience in the company, £500, and to his gardeners, chauffeurs, and servants in his employ for 10 years or more, £200, all significant amounts for those who benefitted.<ref name="Courier at RootWeb" />
At the time of his death Bell was living in Kincarrathie House, Perth, with his wife. Camilla later donated the house to the Kincarrathie Trust, who now run the house as a retirement home.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kincarrathie House|url=http://www.scottish-places.info/features/featurefirst89862.html|publisher=Gazetteer for Scotland|accessdate=13 July 2014}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [https://www.bbc.co.uk/arts/yourpaintings/paintings/arthur-kinmond-bell-18681942-philanthropist-212323 Portrait of Arthur Kinmond Bell on BBC – Your Paintings site]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bell, Arthur Kinmond}} [[Category:Scottish businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Perth, Scotland]] [[Category:People educated at Perth Academy]] [[Category:1868 births]] [[Category:1942 deaths]] [[Category:Scottish philanthropists]]

{{No footnotes|date=March 2016}} [[File:Bendix Trophy.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The Bendix Trophy. This one is on display at the [[National Air and Space Museum]] in [[Washington, D.C.]]]] The '''Bendix Trophy''' is a U.S. [[air racing|aeronautical racing]] trophy. The transcontinental, point-to-point race, sponsored by industrialist [[Vincent Hugo Bendix|Vincent Bendix]] founder of [[Bendix Corporation]], began in 1931 as part of the [[National Air Races]]. Initial prize money for the winners was $15,000. The last Bendix Trophy Race was flown in 1962. The trophy was brought back in 1998 by [[AlliedSignal]], the then-owner of the Bendix [[brand|brand name]] (which later merged with [[Honeywell]]), to "recognize contributions to aerospace safety by individuals or institutions through innovation in advanced safety equipment and equipment utilization." The current awards of the ''Honeywell Bendix Trophy for Aviation Safety'' includes a scale reproduction of the original Bendix Trophy design and a citation. ==The race== The purpose was to interest engineers in building faster, more reliable, and durable aircraft. Bendix competitors flew from [[Burbank, California]], to [[Cleveland, Ohio]], except for two years when the contest began in New York and ended in Los Angeles. Famous competitors for the trophy included [[Jimmy Doolittle]], who won the first race, and several women. [[Amelia Earhart]] was the first woman to enter the Bendix, taking fifth place in 1935. In 1936, [[Louise Thaden]] and her copilot [[Blanche Noyes]] won the race. [[Laura Ingalls (aviator)|Laura Ingalls]] finished second. In 1938, [[Jacqueline Cochran]], arguably the greatest female aviator of all time, took home the trophy. [[Paul Mantz]] was the only pilot to ever win the Bendix three consecutive years, from 1946 through 1948. The race was not run during [[World War II]]. Postwar winners were frequently military veterans from the [[United States Army Air Forces]]: the 1956 winner, [[Manuel J. Fernandez|Capt. Manuel Fernandez Jr.]], was the third-ranking Korean War USAAF ace. By the 1960s, American interest in air racing declined. This was probably due to an increased focus on [[Space Race|the space race]] during this time. Lt. [[Richard F. Gordon Jr.]], the winner in 1961, went on to become an [[astronaut]] with [[NASA]]. ==Mister Mulligan== ''Mister Mulligan'' ([[Howard DGA-6]]), commissioned and flown by Ben Howard in the 1935 race, was the only airplane ever designed for the specific purpose of winning the Bendix Trophy. The plane was designed and developed by Ben Howard and [[Gordon Israel]], who went on the become an engineer for the [[Grumman Aircraft Engineering Corporation]]. ''Mister Mulligan'' was designed to fly the entire length of the race nonstop and at high altitude. Neither had ever been done before. Howard and Israel, who co-piloted, won the trophy, changed how long distance airplanes were designed. The second place plane in the 1935 race was actually a faster airplane, but had to make refuelling stops, which cost enough time to prevent [[Roscoe Turner]] from winning the race. The time difference was only 23.5 seconds between first and second place. The winning difference in speed, over the total distance was less than {{convert|0.2|mi/h|km/h|abbr=on}}. ''Mister Mulligan'' achieved {{convert|238.70|mi/h|km/h|abbr=on}}, compared to Roscoe Turner's {{convert|238.52|mi/h|km/h|abbr=on}}. ''Mister Mulligan'' not only won the Bendix, but also the [[Thompson Trophy]], when flown by Harold Neumann in 1935. Instead of a cross-country distance race, the Thompson was a closed-circuit race around pylons, a type of race for which it was not particularly well suited. Entered again in the Bendix in 1936, the ''Mister Mulligan'' was completely destroyed when the craft lost one of the propeller blades, resulting in a forced landing, {{convert|40|mi|km}} north of [[Crownpoint, New Mexico]]; this crash landing almost killed Howard and his co-pilot wife, Maxine. ==Winners==

Atglen, Pennsylvania: Schiffer Publishing Company, 1993. {{ISBN|978-0-88740-530-3}}. ==External links== {{Commons category|Bendix Trophy}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20051210070732/http://www.flightsafety.org/bendix_trophy.html The Honeywell Bendix Trophy for Aviation Safety] at [[Flight Safety Foundation]] homepage * [https://web.archive.org/web/20041021001811/http://www.55srwa.org/0301/01010803-03.html Kenny's Long Shot] about Kenny's 1954 Bendix Trophy run {{Bendix}} [[Category:Air races]] [[Category:Aviation awards]] [[Category:Awards established in 1931]]

{{Infobox television | | show_name = Cavuto on Business | image = cavutoonbusiness.png | caption = | runtime = 30 minutes | creator = | starring = [[Neil Cavuto]] | country = United States | network = [[Fox News Channel]] | first_aired = 2002 | last_aired = January 13, 2018 | num_episodes = Unknown }} '''''Cavuto on Business''''' is an American [[business]] analysis program, the second show of the ''[[The Cost Of Freedom|Cost of Freedom]]'' business block, on Saturdays at 10:30am ET on the [[Fox News Channel]]. The show is hosted by [[Neil Cavuto]].
Of the four ''Cost of Freedom'' shows, ''Cavuto on Business'' is the only one that features a recurring special guest exclusive to that show: former [[General Electric]] chairman [[Jack Welch]] (Cavuto previously worked for [[NBC]]).
In December 2017, it was announced that the ''Cost of Freedom'' block will be replaced by a new two-hour show, ''[[Cavuto Live]]'', hosted by Cavuto, beginning on January 20, 2018.<ref>{{cite press release|title=Fox News Channel Taps Neil Cavuto to Anchor Live Two-Hour Saturday News Program|url=http://press.foxnews.com/2017/12/fox-news-channel-taps-neil-cavuto-to-anchor-live-two-hour-saturday-news-program/|agency=[[Fox News Channel]]|date=December 13, 2017|accessdate=January 19, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2017/12/neil-cavuto-anchor-saturday-morning-two-hours-fox-news-channel-1202226128/ |last=de Moraes |first=Lisa |title=Neil Cavuto To Anchor Two Hour ‘Cavuto Live’ On Fox News Channel’s Saturdays |date=December 13, 2017 |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Labor}}
'''Civic Openness in Negotiations''' ('''COIN''') is a set of [[Collective Bargaining]] rules involving government agencies and [[Labor union|public labor unions]] intended to ensure [[Transparency (behavior)|transparency]] and [[accountability]]. The process allows for independent fiscal analysis and public scrutiny with a goal of reducing conflicts of interest, accounting for the full cost of agreements, ensuring adequate board review of contracts, and reducing long-term unfunded liabilities and unplanned expense.
COIN is also known as '''OPEN''' ('''Open Public Employee Negotiations''').
==Description==
COIN processes vary but usually have five distinct components:
*'''Independent Negotiator –''' Agencies hire an independent negotiator not impacted by any outcome in the negotiation process. This avoids conflict where agency staff - subject to the same provisions as the bargaining unit they are negotiating with - negotiate on behalf of Agency. *'''Cost of Contracts''' – Under COIN, an agency's independently elected Auditor-Controller or one engaged by the independent negotiator, will take on the responsibility of analyzing the cost of any contract proposal. This ensures an equal playing ground for both labor organizations and the agency as both will be given the ability to comment about the analysis. *'''Offers and Counteroffers''' – COIN requires all offers and counteroffers be disclosed to the public within 24 hours. *'''Board Disclosure''' – Each member of the governing body of an agency will be required to disclose any and all verbal, written, or electronic communications they have had with an official representative of a recognized employee organization. *'''Contract Approval''' – COIN ordinances require, before the final proposed contract is placed on the Board agenda, the [[Memorandum of Understanding]] to be posted on the Agency's website, usually 30 days or two Board meetings prior to board ratification. This allows the public to review contracts and perform independent financial scrutiny and provide public comment prior board ratification.
===Variations===
*'''Acknowledgements''' - Each Agency officer must certify in writing he/she has read and considered the fiscal impacts of each offer. *'''Public Ratification''' - Voters in an Agency's district must ratify by referendum any contract resulting in benefits that cannot be reduced in the future due to constitutional protections or [[ERISA]]. Typically, these are changes to pension plans and tenure provisions.
==History==
The first COIN ordinance was written by Mayor pro-tempore Stephen Mensinger and adopted by [[Costa Mesa]], CA<ref>{{cite web|title=City of Costa Mesa: COIN Ordinance|url=http://www.costamesaca.gov/index.aspx?page=1570}}</ref> in 2012. In subsequent years, it was also adopted by [[Beverly Hills]],<ref>{{cite web|title=City of Beverly Hills COIN Ordinance|url=http://beverlyhills.org/citygovernment/departments/administrativeservices/humanresources/memorandumofunderstanding/?NFR=1}}</ref> [[Fullerton, California|Fullerton]], [[Fountain Valley]], [[Rancho Palos Verdes]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Racho Palos Verdes: OPEN Ordinance|url=http://www.rpvca.gov/801/Labor-Negotiations-OPEN-Ordinance}}</ref> and [[Orange County, California|Orange County]], CA. It has been strongly championed by California State Senator, [[John Moorlach]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Pension Hole|url=https://johnmoorlach.wordpress.com/2015/07/31/moorlach-update-pension-hole-july-31-2015/|website=John Moorlach Blog}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=John|first1=Moorlach|title=Civic Openness in Negotiations hold Elected Officials Accountable|url=http://unionwatch.org/civic-openness-in-negotiations-ordinances-hold-elected-officials-accountable/}}</ref>
In 2015, a [[Civil grand jury|Civil Grand Jury]] in [[Marin County]] recommended the adoption of COIN by county agencies including the operator of the [[Golden Gate Bridge]].<ref>{{cite web|title=The Need for Labor Negotiation Transparency|url=http://www.marincounty.org/~/media/files/departments/gj/reports-responses/2014/gj_labor_neg2.pdf?la=en|website=Civil Grand Jury of Marin County}}</ref>
Generally, COIN has been opposed by organized labor. In 2015, California Governor, Jerry Brown, signed an act officially called CRONEY<ref>{{cite web|title=Civic Reporting Openness in Negotiations Efficiency Act, or CRONEY|url=https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/codes_displayText.xhtml?lawCode=PCC&division=2.&title=&part=3.&chapter=4.5.&article=}}</ref> in the California Public Contract Code, intended to reduce the number of California municipalities adopting COIN.<ref>{{cite news|title=New state law affects agencies, like Costa Mesa, using COIN negotiations rules|url=http://www.latimes.com/socal/daily-pilot/news/tn-dpt-me-1015-crone-law-20151014-story.html|publisher=Los Angeles Times|date=2015-10-15}}</ref> Referring to [[Crony capitalism|Crony Capitalism]], the official title was changed through an opposing legislator's last minute amendment without public disclosure or comment to illustrate the problems of closed and nontransparent government practices.
==See also== *[[Transparency (behavior)]] *[[Open government]] *[[Crony Capitalism]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Labor relations]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | image =C. Marzocco.jpg | image_size = | name = Claudio Marzocco | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1959|02|21|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Andora]], Italy | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | restingplace = | nationality = Italian | religion = | ethnicity = | residence = | education = | alma mater = [[University of Padova]] | occupation = CEO, [[Marzocco Group]] | known for = | salary = | networth = | spouse = | parents = Domenico Marzocco | children = | relatives = | website = http://www.claudiomarzocco.fr/ }}
'''Claudio Marzocco''' (born 21 February 1959) is an Italian engineer and businessman. He is the chief executive officer (CEO) of the [[Marzocco Group]], one of the leading [[real estate development]] companies in [[Monaco]].<ref>[https://www.ellisphere.fr/dirigeant/MARZOCCO-CLAUDIO-19590221 Ellisphere], France.</ref>
==Education and early career== In 1983, Marzocco graduated from the [[University of Padova]] with a [[civil engineering]] diploma and started working as an engineer in the construction sector in Italy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://telescoop.tv/browse/388714/17/monaco-les-coulisses-du-rocher.html|title=Telescoop.|publisher=Telescoop.tv|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> In 1988, he was kidnapped for two weeks by the Calabria-based mafia [[N'drangheta]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.archiviolastampa.it/component/option,com_lastampa/task,search/mod,libera/action,viewer/Itemid,3/page,8/articleid,0955_01_1988_0020_0008_12933306/|title=La Stampa.|publisher=Archiviolastamp.it|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> The kidnappers demanded a ransom from the Marzocco family, but Claudio Marzocco managed to escape after 15 days of abduction. “A week later, my whole family moved to Monaco where we found security for both ourselves and our business”, he said during an interview with French magazine L’Express.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lexpress.fr/region/a-monaco-l-empire-de-beton-de-la-famille-pastor_1296649.html|title=L'Express.|work=L'EXPRESS.fr|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref>
==Marzocco Group== The Marzocco Group was founded in the 1960s by Domenico Marzocco, father of Claudio Marzocco.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://24heuresactu.com/2013/11/13/groupe-marzocco-une-dynastie-de-constructeurs/|title=24heuresactu.|work=24heuresactu.com|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> The same year Claudio Marzocco was kidnapped, after moving to Monaco, he established the Marzocco Group in Monaco,<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AC-seYj5dY4 Montecarlo World Network.]</ref> which was soon oriented as a real estate development company specializing in luxury buildings.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tempsreel.nouvelobs.com/societe/20130830.AFP3703/a-monaco-les-49-etages-de-la-tour-odeon-attendent-leurs-millionnaires.html|title=Le Nouvel Observateur.|date=30 August 2013|work=nouvelobs.com|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> The Marzocco group, which is fully owned and managed by members of the Marzocco family, is now considered one of Monaco's leading real-estate development companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ekonomico.fr/2013/12/dandros-a-marzocco-les-entreprises-familiales/|title=D’Andros à Marzocco : les entreprises familiales|work=Ekonomico|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> Claudio Marzocco is the current{{when|date=October 2014}} company's [[Chief Executive Officer]]. His brothers Luca Marzocco, as well as Claudio’s sons Daniele and Niccolò, as well as his nephew Domenico Della Bella are also board members.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.groupemarzocco.mc/fr/who-we-are/executive-teams|title=Groupe Marzocco Organization Chart.|publisher=Groupemarzocco.mc|accessdate=11 October 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140803075420/http://www.groupemarzocco.mc/fr/who-we-are/executive-teams#|archive-date=2014-08-03|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
==Projects== ===Tour Odéon (2014)=== The Tour Odéon ([[Odeon Tower (Monaco)|Odeon Tower]])<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.odeon.mc/#/home|title=Tour Odéon Monaco|publisher=Odeon.mc|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> is the tallest building in Monaco and one of the tallest ever built in [[Europe]]. It is a 170-meter high double skyscraper located in the neighborhood of La Rousse-Saint-Roman in [[Monte Carlo]]. It includes private apartments, business quarters and offices of the Principality public services.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/mhj45edjhe/tour-odeonmonaco/|title=Forbes.|work=Forbes|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref>
The Tour Odéon project, a 49-storey building, was launched in 2009 <ref>[http://www.referencementgoogle.eu/2013/07/26/tour-odeon-claudio-marzocco-fait-le-buzz-sur-la-toile/ ReferencementGoogle.]</ref> and has been conceived as a full-service luxury building.
The 3,500 square meters (37,674 square feet) penthouse apartment, with its large outdoor swimming-pool, located at the top of the building is the most expensive apartment to ever be put on the market for an asking price of 300 million euros.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2729501/Inside-worlds-expensive-apartment-Penthouse-Monacos-new-Odeon-Tower-complete-water-slide-private-chauffeur-caterer-set-potential-owner-240MILLION.html|title=Inside the world's most expensive apartment in Monaco|work=Mail Online|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref>
===Les Gaumates (2010)=== Les Gaumates is a luxury residential building located at 1, Boulevard Princesse Charlotte in Monaco.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://structurae.net/structures/villa-les-gaumates|title=Structurea.|publisher=Structurae.net|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref>
The building is an 8-storey villa (in addition to five underground floors mostly used as parking space) which was inaugurated in 2010. It is in the [[Belle Epoque]] architectural style and has a view of the [[Monte Carlo Bay]].
===Ilôt Rainier III (2012)=== Ilôt Rainier III is the largest real estate development project of the 21st century in Monaco.{{citation needed|date=October 2014}} The 4 building project gathers 243 apartments as well as a parking space. It was inaugurated in 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.satri.mc/en/realizations/buildings/ilot-rainier-iii/|title=Satri.|author=SATRI -|publisher=Satri.mc|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref>
Ilôt Rainier III was the first building in Monaco to receive the High Environmental Quality Certification.{{citation needed|date=October 2014}} It also received the THPE 2005 Label for very high energy performance, which was delivered to Prince Albert on 2, May 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.qualite-logement.org/actualites/archives/detail/premiere-operation-certifiee-a-monaco.html|title=Première opération certifiée à Monaco|date=2 October 2014|publisher=Qualite-logement.org|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref>
===Other projects=== The following are other projects:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.groupemarzocco.mc/fr/properties|title=Groupe Marzocco|publisher=Groupemarzocco.mc|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> *Le Saint-André *Le Suffren *Le Cirius *Le Roc-Azur *Le Sea Club *Villa De Rome *Villa Hermosa *Villa Montjoie *Villa Bromar *Ilôt Canton (in progress) *Le Tamaris (in progress) *Testimonio 2 (in progress)
==Horse racing== Claudio Marzocco owns a professional racing stable with more than twenty horses. His most successful horse is [[Lawman (horse)|Lawman]]. Lawman won the [[Prix du Jockey Club]] and the [[Prix Jean Prat]] in 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.geny.com/arrivee-et-rapports-pmu/2007-07-08-chantilly-pmu-prix-jean-prat_c176522|title=Geny.|publisher=Geny.com|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> Since being retired to stud he has made a good start as a stallion: siring Group 1 winners Most Improved, Just the Judge and Law Enforcement. Lawman was trained by Jean-Marie Béguigné. Lawman was awarded an official rating of 120 for his win in the Prix Jean Prat, ranking him as the joint 34th best racehorse in the world in 2007.
==Social activities== Claudio Marzocco is an active member of several prestigious social organizations in Monaco such as the Monte Carlo Yacht Club, the Monte-Carlo Country Club, the Automobile Club of Monaco,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ordinecostantiniano.it/monegasque-association-announces-charity-project-schools-principality-welcomes-h-e-philippe-narmino-minister-justice-amongst-knights/?lang=en|title=The Monegasque Association announces a charity project and welcomes H.E. Philippe Narmino, Minister of Justice, amongst the Knights - Sito Ufficiale del Sacro Militare Ordine Costantiniano di San Giorgio - Official Site of the Sacred Military Constantinian Order of St George - Site Officiel de l’Ordre Sacré et Militaire Constantinien de Saint-Georges - Sitio official de la Sagrada Orden Militar Constantiniana de San Jorge - Die offizielle Webseite des heiligen konstantinischen Ritterordens vom Heiligen Georg - Site Oficial da Sagrada e Militar Ordem Constantiniana de São Jorge - Официальный сайт Священного Военного Константинианского Oрденa Святого Георгия|work=Sito Ufficiale del Sacro Militare Ordine Costantiniano di San Giorgio - Official Site of the Sacred Military Constantinian Order of St George - Site Officiel de l’Ordre Sacré et Militaire Constantinien de Saint-Georges - Sitio official de la Sagrada Orden Militar Constantiniana de San Jorge - Die offizielle Webseite des heiligen konstantinischen Ritterordens vom Heiligen Georg - Site Oficial da Sagrada e Militar Ordem Constantiniana de São Jorge - Официальный сайт Священного Военного Константинианского Oрденa Святого Георгия|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> the Monte-Carlo Golf Club<ref>[http://www.calameo.com/books/000001823d211b74701f0Calameo] {{dead link|date=October 2014}}</ref> or the Monaco Ambassadors Club.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.montecarloin.net/incontri-e-video_2397284.html|title=Montecarloin.|publisher=Calameo.com|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref>
==Decorations== *Chevalier de l’Ordre de Saint Charles (Monaco) in 2006<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ordinecostantiniano.it/author/smcosg/page/3/?lang=fr|title=admin, Author at Sito Ufficiale del Sacro Militare Ordine Costantiniano di San Giorgio - Official Site of the Sacred Military Constantinian Order of St George - Site Officiel de l’Ordre Sacré et Militaire Constantinien de Saint-Georges - Sitio official de la Sagrada Orden Militar Constantiniana de San Jorge - Die offizielle Webseite des heiligen konstantinischen Ritterordens vom Heiligen Georg - Site Oficial da Sagrada e Militar Ordem Constantiniana de São Jorge - Официальный сайт Священного Военного Константинианского Oрденa Святого Георгия - Page 3 de 10|work=Sito Ufficiale del Sacro Militare Ordine Costantiniano di San Giorgio - Official Site of the Sacred Military Constantinian Order of St George - Site Officiel de l’Ordre Sacré et Militaire Constantinien de Saint-Georges - Sitio official de la Sagrada Orden Militar Constantiniana de San Jorge - Die offizielle Webseite des heiligen konstantinischen Ritterordens vom Heiligen Georg - Site Oficial da Sagrada e Militar Ordem Constantiniana de São Jorge - Официальный сайт Священного Военного Константинианского Oрденa Святого Георгия|accessdate=11 October 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141016230948/http://www.ordinecostantiniano.it/author/smcosg/page/3/?lang=fr#|archive-date=2014-10-16|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> *Officier de l’Ordre de Saint Charles (Monaco) in 2014<ref>[http://cloud.gouv.mc/Dataweb/jourmon.nsf/9bf97b0da6308cfdc12568c40037f873/59cc464c07fd2df6c1257d9600501868/$FILE/JO8200%20OS%205044%20St%20Charles.pdf]</ref> *Premio “Foglio d’Oro 2008”<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.royalmonaco.net/article-monte-carlo-premio-alla-professionalita-italiana-nel-mondo-100037849.html|title=MONTE CARLO, PREMIO ALLA PROFESSIONALITA' ITALIANA NEL MONDO - ROYAL MONACO RIVIERA|work=ROYAL MONACO RIVIERA|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref> *Cavaliere dell’Ordine della “Stella d’Italia” (Italy) in 2013<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.quirinale.it/elementi/Onorificenze.aspx?pag=1&qIdOnorificenza=55&cognome=&nome=&daAnno=1800&aAnno=2013&luogoNascita=&testo=&ordinamento=2 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-09-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140910200024/http://www.quirinale.it/elementi/Onorificenze.aspx?pag=1&qIdOnorificenza=55&cognome=&nome=&daAnno=1800&aAnno=2013&luogoNascita=&testo=&ordinamento=2 |archivedate=2014-09-10 |df= }}</ref> *Commandeur de Merite avec Plaque de l’Ordre Sacré et Militaire Constantinien de Saint-Georges (Monaco) in 2013<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ordinecostantiniano.it/lassociation-monegasque-de-lordre-constantinien-de-saint-georges-accueille-parmi-ses-nouveaux-chevaliers-s-e-m-philippe-narmino-directeur-des-services-judiciaires-de-monaco-et-soutient/?lang=fr|title=L’Ass. Monégasque accueille parmi ses nouveaux chevaliers S.E.M. Philippe Narmino Directeur des Services Judiciaires et soutient un innovateur projet éducatif - Sito Ufficiale del Sacro Militare Ordine Costantiniano di San Giorgio - Official Site of the Sacred Military Constantinian Order of St George - Site Officiel de l’Ordre Sacré et Militaire Constantinien de Saint-Georges - Sitio official de la Sagrada Orden Militar Constantiniana de San Jorge - Die offizielle Webseite des heiligen konstantinischen Ritterordens vom Heiligen Georg - Site Oficial da Sagrada e Militar Ordem Constantiniana de São Jorge - Официальный сайт Священного Военного Константинианского Oрденa Святого Георгия|work=Sito Ufficiale del Sacro Militare Ordine Costantiniano di San Giorgio - Official Site of the Sacred Military Constantinian Order of St George - Site Officiel de l’Ordre Sacré et Militaire Constantinien de Saint-Georges - Sitio official de la Sagrada Orden Militar Constantiniana de San Jorge - Die offizielle Webseite des heiligen konstantinischen Ritterordens vom Heiligen Georg - Site Oficial da Sagrada e Militar Ordem Constantiniana de São Jorge - Официальный сайт Священного Военного Константинианского Oрденa Святого Георгия|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref>
==Controversy== On 14 February 2012, Claudio Marzocco was indicted in France, along with his brother Paolo, in an alleged corruption scandal involving a local politician from [[Beausoleil, Alpes-Maritimes|Beausoleil]] (France).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.monacomatin.mc/article/home-page/deux-promoteurs-monegasques-de-la-tour-odeon-mis-en-examen.790930.html|title=Deux promoteurs monégasques de la tour Odéon mis en examen|publisher=Monacomatin.mc|accessdate=11 October 2014}}</ref>
The Regional Court of Marseille, by its judgement of 27 January 2017, acquitted Claudio Marzocco and Paolo Marzocco.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.monacolife.net/acquittals-in-long-running-odeon-tower-case/|title=Acquittals in long-running Odeon Tower case|publisher=www.monacolife.net|accessdate=27 January 2017}}</ref>
==External links== *[http://www.claudiomarzocco.fr/ Claudio Marzocco]

revision.text:
El Consejo Mexicano de la Industria de Productos de Consumo, A.C. (ConMéxico) agrupa a 45 empresas líderes en los mercados de alimentos y bebidas, bebidas alcohólicas y productos de cuidado personal y del hogar, cuyas marcas gozan de alto reconocimiento por parte de los consumidores mexicanos.
Desde su fundación, ConMéxico promueve el bienestar del consumidor, estableciendo y desarrollando vínculos comerciales y de responsabilidad social con proveedores, clientes y aliados estratégicos que aporten beneficios a la cadena de valor y, en consecuencia, al desarrollo económico y social del país.
En conjunto, las empresas asociadas a ConMéxico emplean directamente a alrededor de 450 mil trabajadores y generan ventas anuales superiores al 3.5% del PIB nacional.

'''David H. Chafey Jr.''' is a [[business executive]] and the current [[chairman of the board]] of the [[Puerto Rico Government Development Bank]]. Before the GDB, Chafey was the Chief Operating Officer of [[Popular, Inc.]] and former President of [[Banco Popular de Puerto Rico]]. Chafey is a member of the [[Caribbean Business]] Hall of Fame in recognition of him being named one of Puerto Rico's Top Ten Business Leaders for the fifth year in a row in 2008.<ref name="caribbeanbusinesspr.com">[http://www.caribbeanbusinesspr.com/view_profile02.php?ej_id=1&an_id=35 Puerto Rico's Top Business Leaders: David H. Chafey Jr.]</ref>
==Career== Chafey began his career at Banco Popular in 1980 as vice president of the Investment Division and became senior vice president of the Investment Group in 1985. He was appointed CFO in 1990, in charge of the Financial Management Group, senior executive vice president in charge of Retail Banking Group in 1995, and president of Banco Popular de Puerto Rico in 2004. In 2009, he was appointed president and chief operating officer of Popular, Inc.
==Education== Chafey received his bachelor's degree in finance from the [[Fairfield University Dolan School of Business]] and master of business administration from the [[New York University Stern School of Business]].
==See also== *[[List of famous Puerto Ricans]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.fairfield.edu/ar_chafeybio.html Fairfield University Alumni Professional Achievement Award] *[http://www.puertoricowow.com/html/eng/b-leadersresult.php?NAME=Chafey+Jr.,+David+H. Puerto Rico's Top Business Leaders: David H. Chafey Jr.] *[http://www.nasdaq.com/aspx/company-news-story.aspx?storyid=201005240926rttraderusequity_0578&title=popular-appoints-richard-carrin-to-succeed-david-chafey-as-president---quick-facts]

{{more footnotes|date=June 2010}} {{use American English|date=May 2016}} {{use mdy dates|date=May 2016}} The '''Dogs of the Dow''' is an [[investment strategy]] popularized by Michael B. O'Higgins in 1991, which proposes that an investor annually select for investment the ten [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] (DJIA) stocks whose [[dividend]] is the highest fraction of their price.
==History== Selecting some components of the DJIA is not a new idea. An article by H. G. Schneider was published in ''[[The Journal of Finance]]'' in 1951, based on selecting stocks by their [[price–earnings ratio]].<ref>Staff (undated). [http://www.investorhome.com/dogs.htm "'Dogs of the Dow' and the 'Foolish Four'"]. investorhome.com. Retrieved May 11, 2016.</ref>
==Concept== Proponents of the Dogs of the Dow strategy argue that [[Blue chip (stock market)|blue-chip]] companies do not alter their dividend to reflect trading conditions and, therefore, the dividend is a measure of the average worth of the company; the stock price, in contrast, fluctuates through the [[business cycle]]. This should mean that companies with a [[High-yield stocks|high yield]], with a high dividend relative to stock price, are near the bottom of their business cycle and are likely to see their stock price increase faster than low-yield companies.
Under this model, an investor annually reinvesting in high-yield companies should out-perform the overall market. The logic behind this is that a high-dividend yield suggests both that the stock is oversold and that management believes in its company's prospects and is willing to back that up by paying out a relatively high dividend. Investors are thereby hoping to benefit from both above-average stock-price gains as well as a relatively high quarterly dividend. Of course, several assumptions are made in this argument.
The first assumption is that the dividend price reflects the company size rather than the company business model. The second is that companies have a natural, repeating cycle in which good performances are predicted by bad ones. Due to the nature of the concept, the Dogs may come from a small number of sectors. For example, the ten stocks that belonged to the 2015 Dogs of the Dow list came from only six sectors, including industrials, energy, and healthcare,<ref>{{Cite web| author = Chart (undated) | url = http://hellomoney.co/portfolio/3701a6-dogs-of-the-dow-2015|title = Dogs of the Dow 1015 – Comparing Performance Between S&P 500 and Dogs of the Dow – Stock List Is Based on DogsOfTheDow.com. | access-date = May 11, 2016 | publisher = Hello Money (hellomoney.co)}}</ref> in contrast to the [[S&P 500 Index]] which covers eleven sectors.
==Results== O'Higgins and others back-tested the strategy as far back as the 1920s and found that investing in the Dogs consistently outperformed the market as a whole. Since that time, the data shows that the Dogs of the Dow as well as the popular variant, the Small Dogs of the Dow, have performed well.
For example, for the twenty years from 1992 to 2011, the Dogs of the Dow matched the average annual total return of the DJIA (10.8 percent) and outperformed the S&P 500 (9.6 percent), as reported by the [http://www.dogsofthedow.com/ Dogs of the Dow] website located at dogsofthedow.com.
The Small Dogs of the Dow, which are the five lowest-priced Dogs of the Dow, outperformed both the Dow and S&P 500 with an average annual total return of 12.6 percent.<ref>{{cite web| author = Staff (undated) | title= Dogs of the Dow Total Return: Dog Years|url=http://www.dogsofthedow.com/dogyrs.htm|publisher= Dogs of the Dow | access-date = May 11, 2016}}</ref>
When each individual year is reviewed, it is clear that both the Dogs of the Dow and Small Dogs of the Dow did not outperform each and every year. In fact, the Dogs of the Dow and Small Dogs of the Dow struggled to keep up with the Dow during latter stages of the [[dot-com boom|dot-com boom (1998 and 1999)]] as well as during the [[Financial crisis of 2007–08|financial crisis (2007–2009)]].<ref>{{cite web| author = Staff (undated) | title=Dogs of the Dow|url=http://www.dogsofthedow.com |publisher=Dogs of the Dow | access-date = May 11, 2016}}</ref> This suggests that an investor would be best served by viewing this as a longer-term strategy by giving this portfolio of stocks time to recover in case of a rare-but-extreme economic event (e.g., dot-com boom, financial crisis).
==Criticism== On January 8, 2014, John S. Tobey wrote an article in ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine where he criticized the Dogs. He said that it should use [[price weighting]], instead of [[equal weighting]], because that is what the DJIA uses. He said that, for the year 2013, using the price weighting the Dogs would have returned less, rather than more, than the DJIA. He suggested that it is too simple and it should use more factors such as [[dividend payout ratio|dividend–payout ratio]], growth of cash and earnings, price performance, and many other things. However, he did not say how to combine these into a strategy. He also criticized it for back-testing (although the method was published in 1991). He also said that the strategy would not work well for 2014.<ref>{{cite web|date = January 8, 2014 | author = Tobey John S. | title=Ditch 'Dogs of the Dow' – The Mutts Have Bad Genes, Improper Breeding and False Papers | work = [[Forbes]] | url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/johntobey/2014/01/08/ditch-dogs-of-the-dow-the-mutts-have-bad-genes-improper-breeding-and-false-papers | access-date = May 11, 2016}}</ref>
==See also== {{portal|Business and economics}} * [[S&P Dow Jones Indexes]] * [[Foolish Four]] {{clear}}
==References== {{reflist}}
==Bibliography== * O'Higgins, Michael; Downes, John (2000, revised and updated). ''Beating the Dow – A High-Return, Low-Risk Method for Investing in the Dow Jones Industrial Stocks with as Little as $5,000''. [[HarperBusiness]]. {{ISBN|978-0066620473}}.
==External links== * [http://www.dogsofthedow.com/ Dogs of the Dow] has been tracking this investment strategy since 1995 * [http://www.dogsofthedow.com/dogday.htm Latest performance of the Dogs of the Dow] * [http://www.investorhome.com/dogs.htm Dogs of the Dow and the 'Foolish Four']
{{stock market}}
